intro: Lotus dendroideus var. traskiae, commonly known as the Trask's tree lotus, is a rare and striking member of the legume family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. This plant is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems that can grow up to several meters in height, forming a tree-like structure. Its leaves are bipinnately compound, and it produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water from underground sources.
